findings.title: Improper redeem() Function Implementation
findings.description: The _redeem() function contains an issue with the redemption period validation, using >= instead of >.

findings.title: Incorrect Return Value in _claimExchangeToken() Function
findings.description: Due to the incorrect return value of the _claimExchangeToken() function, users end up paying less of the payment token than required to purchase launchpad tokens.

findings.title: Lack of Native Token Payment Handling
findings.description: Users are unable to redeem their launchpad tokens and retrieve their native tokens, the operation of the launchpad will be stopped.

findings.title: Uninitialized _allocsLastUpdated State Assignment
findings.description: The first users that invoke the commit() function in the StarshipPool contract will receive a large reward instantly due to uninitialized _allocsLastUpdated state.

findings.title: Improper User Debt Update
findings.description: The incorrect calculation of user allocations results in a scenario where each user acquires a higher launchpad allocation than anticipated.

findings.title: Missing Access Control Modifier on setLaunchpadLimit() Function
findings.description: The launchpad limit configuration can be arbitrarily set by anyone, allowing an attacker to maliciously define the maxAmount and maxPerUser, leading to a denial of service.

findings.title: Improper User Share Update
findings.description: During the claim phase, users with remaining shares will lose their payment tokens, and the total share count will not be reduced.

findings.title: Centralized Authority Control
findings.description: The controlling authorities have the ability to manipulate critical state variables, altering the contract's behavior and potentially increasing their profits.

findings.title: Insufficient Claim Start Time Validation
findings.description: The redemption period condition check in the _redeem() function of the StarshipPool contract does not align with the onlyRedeemTime modifier, preventing users from redeeming their tokens when _launchpadInfo.claimStartTimestamp is equal to block.timestamp.

findings.title: Improper Function Visibility
findings.description: Public functions that are never called internally by the contract itself should have external visibility to improve readability and distinguish between externally used and internally called functions.

findings.title: Outdated Compiler Version
findings.description: The smart contracts were compiled with outdated Solidity compiler versions, which may lead to security vulnerabilities and missing features.
